title: Bullion-n-BTC
author: Bullion-n-BTC
content: Anybody have an extra one of these they’d possibly trade / sell? The ridge iron piece was the first physical crypto type piece I ever laid eyes on and got me into collecting physical crypto. Would love to own one but the link to websites either doesn’t work or they don’t respond to messages. Figured it was worth a shot to ask. Images below if I did it right:

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: probably easier to ask for the top coin by maker "CryptoVault" rather than the coin name.Even their logo "CV" lends itself to the company nameLooks like the bottom one had a kickstarter back in 2019Wonder if they produced them?https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1173199625/cold-storage-wallet-for-bitcoin-and-cryptocurrenci

comments.author: Suzuki Matt
comments.body: I never seen one of these before. That's pretty cool.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Reminds of that one coin I have where you use a tool to hold coin and smack it to separate the center piece to reveal the cavity inside

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Suzuki Matt on April 29, 2023, 03:56:41 PMI never seen one of these before. That's pretty cool. I haven't either.  Judging from your difficulty in finding it and the non-responsiveness to your attempts, I have to wonder if this was something that actually exists or what it a project that was never completed.  When you say you "laid eyes on it."  Does that mean you've actually seen on of these in person and that you have confirmed they exist?  This seems like a pretty cool little collectible to not have a presence on this form in one way or another.  Maybe it does and we just aren't aware, but it seems like this could be one of those ideas that never came to be.

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on April 29, 2023, 05:48:25 PMQuote from: Suzuki Matt on April 29, 2023, 03:56:41 PMI never seen one of these before. That's pretty cool. I haven't either.  Judging from your difficulty in finding it and the non-responsiveness to your attempts, I have to wonder if this was something that actually exists or what it a project that was never completed.  When you say you "laid eyes on it."  Does that mean you've actually seen on of these in person and that you have confirmed they exist?  This seems like a pretty cool little collectible to not have a presence on this form in one way or another.  Maybe it does and we just aren't aware, but it seems like this could be one of those ideas that never came to be. Yes sir they exist. I believe I know a guy with the bottom coin let me see if I can contact him for real life pics of finished product. Now I’m curious

comments.author: AT101ET
comments.body: Had one of these back in the day. Definitely amongst the ‘thinner’ physical collectibles out there.
